essay.question-text:
Do you agree or disagree with the following statement?
One should never make an important decision quickly.
Use reasons and examples to support your answer.
essay.sample-answer-text:
SAMPLE ANSWER
I absolutely agree that one shouldn't make important decisions quickly. For decisions about things that don't really matter, it may be OK, but decisions that can have lasting repercussions should be thought through with care.
When someone has only a short time to decide something important like which school to attend or which job offer to take, he or she might make a poor decision because of stress. Deciding on a school or job requires research and a careful look at the pros and cons of each option. People who are in a rush to decide can easily overlook important considerations and make the wrong choice because something looked good just at first glance.
Three years ago, I had to make an important decision in a very short time, a decision about what job to take, and I didn't make the best choice. I was in a rush and didn't think things through. I would've made a better choice if I had just asked for more time to decide. This is why I really believe important decisions shouldn't be made too quickly.
